author: MSNBC.com
title: Jon Meacham in his own words about the role of consoler-in-chief
description: Historian Jon Meacham reflects on how past presidents have stirred the nation amid times of crisis, as the nation faces a grim milestone: 100,000 dead from coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Michigan Lt. Gov.: Trump is ‘dead wrong’ on mail-in voting
description: As President Trump continues to make baseless claims about mail-in voting leading to fraud, Michigan Lt. Governor Garlin Gilchrist notes that 'more people are killed by deer in a year than have ever been proven to commit voter fraud.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Carville to Trump: ‘Go play golf, man, at least you're not talking to the public’
description: Longtime Democratic strategist James Carville responds to President Tump’s attacks on Joe Biden, telling Kasie Hunt, 'Anybody can make a gaffe, make a word come out the wrong way. Nobody ever stood in front of the whole United States and told them to drink Cl…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr. U.S. Surgeon General: No one should take hydroxychloroquine unless doctor prescribes it
description: After a week in which President Trump said he was taking the controversial drug hydroxychloroquine, former U.S. Surgeon General Richard Carmona says 'the evidence, thus far, indicates that it is not successful in its use as a drug to deal with COVID-19.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: RNC says it has sued CA Governor Newsom over mail-in ballots
description: As President Trump and the Republican party escalate their attacks on mail-in voting, fmr. Rep. David Jolly says 'Republicans are standing in between voters and their right to vote.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Peters: ‘We need to call out the Chinese for actions they’ve taken’
description: As rhetoric on both sides of the aisle heats up around China, Sen. Gary Peters (D-MI), ranking member on the Homeland Security Committee, tells Kasie Hunt that Beijing needs to be called out for cyber attacks on U.S. medical facilities involved in vaccine dev…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘It wasn't supposed to happen this way. The America I grew up in was supposed to do better.’
description: As the death toll from coronavirus in the U.S. approaches 100,000, Kasie Hunt reflects on American leadership ahead of Memorial Day.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: FedEx under fire as racial discrimination allegations surface
description: Joined by former FedEx employee Darnell Lundy and civil rights attorney Benjamin Crump, Rev. Al Sharpton gains insight into the viral incident.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Trump tamps down virus fears, says schools should reopen
description: The Morning Joe panel discusses the president's attempts to tamp down fears on the coronavirus and why he's calling for U.S. schools to reopen immediately.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Trump golfs and attacks opponents as death toll nears 100,000
description: The panel discusses how President Trump is spending his Memorial Day weekend, which includes golfing in Virginia and spending time on Twitter attacking opponents.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Senator says his state hit hard by virus and flooding
description: Sen. Gary Peters, D-Mich., discusses the hardships in his state from recent flooding caused by rains and two dams failing. Sen. Peters also discusses Trump's attacks on mail-in voting.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Lincoln Project honors fallen heroes in new ad
description: Conservative group The Lincoln Project is out with a new ad honoring those who have served the country and those who have fallen on this Memorial Day.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: IAVA asks country to #GoSilent to honor those who have fallen
description: Jeremy Butler, CEO of the Iraq and Afghanistan Veterans of America, joins Morning Joe to discuss paying tribute to those who have served and to discuss issues facing U.S. veterans.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: David Frum: After Trump, how do we rebuild?
description: Author David Frum joins Morning Joe to discuss his new book 'Trumpocalypse: Restoring American Democracy.'
source.name: MSNBC

title: Fact-checking virus impact on children ahead of summer
description: As new waves of coronavirus appear in the South and Midwest, Dr. Ezekiel Emanuel joins Ayman Mohyeldin to discuss why he thinks summer camps need to be opened and how that can be accomplished.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Rep. Max Rose: Veterans ‘were not superhuman, but did superhuman things’
description: Watch New York Congressman Max Rose join Ayman Mohyeldin to discuss how the president ended National Guard virus deployment before benefits kick in and his push for PPP for small businesses.
source.name: MSNBC

title: NC Mayor: ‘There’s a lot of pressure’ to prepare safely for summer
description: This weekend marked the unofficial start to summer, but it’s a summer like we’ve never experienced before. Kill Devil Hills, NC Mayor Ben Sproul joins Ayman Mohyeldin to discuss how he plans to manage crowds and expectations.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Tom Nichols weighs in on 'The Most Unmanly President'
description: 'Why don't the president's supporters hold him to their own standard of masculinity?,' Tom Nichols asks in his new piece for The Atlantic. Nichols joins Morning Joe to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: New series chronicles the life of Ulysses S. Grant
description: Pulitzer Prize-winning biographer Ron Chernow and Fmr. CIA Director Gen. David Petraeus join Morning Joe to discuss the new six-hour miniseries 'Grant,' on President Ulyssess S. Grant.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: How masks have been politicized even as more states require them to stop virus's spread
description: Dr. Vanessa Kerry and Rick Stengel join Andrea Mitchell to discuss the politicization of guidance around mask wearing, with more states now requiring their use in public to reduce the virus's spread while President Trump still declines to wear one in public.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: United States to launch Americans into space for first time in nearly decade
description: For the first time in nearly a decade, United States astronauts are about to blast into orbit aboard an American rocket from American soil.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Dr. Redlener: ‘Disaster’ for states to reopen without enough testing
description: Dr. Irwin Redlener says if it were up to him, he’d put a halt to states reopening until sufficient testing measures are put in place.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Missouri hair salon customer: Stylist with COVID-19 ‘should have stayed home’
description: More than 100 people were exposed to the coronavirus while getting a hair cut in Missouri. Two hairstylist at a “Great Clips” in Springfield tested positive for the virus. Officials say one of the stylists worked for eight days while showing symptoms. A custo…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: North Carolina sees highest one-day spike in coronavirus cases
description: North Carolina reported more than 1100 new cases on Saturday, a single day record for the state.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Morning Joe 5/25/20
description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: California issues new guidelines for reopening houses of worship
description: California state officials issued new guidelines for places of worship to reopen. The DOJ had sent a letter to the state last week warning that the existing reopening plans discriminated against churches. Under the new guidelines staff members and congregants…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Jersey Mayor: I feel for all the summer businesses--they really count on tourist season
description: Belmar, NJ Mayor Mark Walsifer joins MSNBC's Craig Melvin to discuss how he is navigating a phased reopening as the pressure to open beaches increases.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NC Mayor Bill Saffo: 'We knew that we would see a spike' moving to reopening phase
description: Wilmington, NC Mayor Bill Saffo joins MSNBC's Craig Melvin following North Carolina's highest one-day spike in coronavirus cases.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Why social distancing remains important while states reopen
description: As states reopen, images emerge of crowds gathered in public during the holiday weekend. Yet despite the reduced risk of the virus's spread outdoors, social...
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Miami Beach Mayor: The city will reopen 'slowly and cautiously...
description: Mayor Dan Gelber (D) of Miami Beach on how the city plans to reopen on June 1 and what to expect next.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Dr. Gupta: 'We need mandatory masks' to reopen
description: Dr. Vin Gupta discusses what needs to be done to reopen safely.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Memorial Day marked by crowds as number of COVID-19 deaths near 100,000
description: Memorial Day marked by crowds, ceremony and uncertainty as the number of COVID-19 deaths in the U.S. nears 100,000 and the number of coronavirus cases continue to rise in most regions of the country.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Honoring medical workers in battle against covid-19
description: NBC's Kevin Tibbles pays homage to the medical workers battling on the frontline of the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Honoring veterans amid the COVID-19 pandemic
description: How do the families of veterans honor their lives in a socially distant world? Associated Press photographer David Goldman found a meaningful way to reflect on the lives of veterans who died of COVID-19.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Trump issues travel ban for Brazil as virus cases spike
description: NBC's Bill Neely discusses the surge in coronavirus cases in Brazil.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Global carbon emissions drop by 17% amid COVID-19 pandemic
description: Rob Jackson, Chair of the Global Carbon Project and Professor of Environmental Sciences at Stanford University, on the significant drop in carbon emissions around the world due to coronavirus lockdowns.
source.name: MSNBC
